intro: Cylindropsis novoguineensis, commonly known as the New Guinea cylinderpod, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of New Guinea. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, elongated seed pods that enclose its small, black seeds. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. The leaves are ovate to elliptic in shape, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface, and the flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-white.
